p: One technical limitation of this study is that we could not confirm mRNA and protein co-expression in the same cells. However, in human cortical tissue, we were able to show PLCÎ³2 immunoreactivity in sparsely located cells with microglia-like morphology, and PLCG2 transcripts were detected in similarly sparsely distributed cells, reminiscent of microglia. Together with the data of Plcg2 expression in mouse tissue, our results strongly point to co-expression of protein and mRNA, at least in microglia in the mammalian cortex.
